main event: Multiple witnesses observed a bright, shiny, metallic object, oval in shape and about the size of a large automobile, traveling at a high rate of speed over Ventura, California on August 13, 1959.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be at an altitude of about 2,000 feet and traveling in a northeast direction.
The object was under observation for about one minute and then suddenly disappeared from sight with no trails or other evidence of its passage observed.
The party of four witnesses, as well as a number of other persons on the pier, agreed that the object was not an aircraft, balloon, or any other known type of aerial vehicle.

In a separate incident on August 12, 1953, an object was observed that appeared to be circling and was the size of a B-29 bomber, at an estimated distance of about 2 miles and altitude of approximately 10,000 feet.
Several other sightings of lights and objects were reported in the Ventura, California area around this time, with some exhibiting unusual maneuvers and disappearance.
sighted object: a bright, shiny, metallic object, oval in shape and about the size of a large automobile
witnesses: a party of four and other unidentified witnesses on a public pier
